name: src/Coach.js
Coach
description:
The central hub of the artefacts and tools of a boxer canvas.
Creating one is among the first steps in using the boxer library.

name: constructor
description: Create a new `Coach` instance rooted at a specific `Canvas` artefact.

params.name: options.root
params.description: the canvas making up the root of our boxer svg artefact tree

name: addTool
description:
the main state machine toggling between `'IDLE'` and `'BUSY'`,
used to coordinate between the local state machines of tools

name: activateExclusiveTools
description: Activate a given set of registered tools and turn off all others.

params.name: chosenTools
params.description: the tools to activate

name: start
description: Start this coach, indicating that all tools have been registered.

name: registerArtefactEvent
description:
Let the coach know that it should start listening to specific types
of DOM events on artefacts, and to provide a way to subscribe to them.
It uses jQuery's delegation feature, so it is relatively efficient,
and it normalizes event objects and supplies them with additional
quick-access data, like the mouse event coordinates as a `Point2D`.

params.name: events
params.description: a set of DOM event names, e.g., `'click'`, `'mouseover'`

name: enrichMouseEvent
description:
Enrich a mouse event object with a `Point2D` object representing
screen coordinates.

params.name: event
params.description: a jQuery event object

unknown.tagValue: {Observable} a stream of `e` events on the root canvas element

params.name: e
params.description: the type of event to get a stream of

return.description: a stream of `e` events on the root canvas element

unknown.tagValue: {Observable} a stream of `e` events on the `window` DOM element

params.name: e
params.description: the type of event to get a stream of

return.description: a stream of `e` events on the `window` DOM element

unknown.tagValue: {Observable} a stream of `e` events on the `document` DOM element

params.name: e
params.description: the type of event to get a stream of

return.description: a stream of `e` events on the `document` DOM element

unknown.tagValue: {Observable} a stream of `e` events on any artefact

params.name: e
params.description: the type of event to get a stream of

return.description: a stream of `e` events on any artefact

params.name: element
params.description: the element for which to get the controller

return.description: the artefact controller in charge of a given SVG DOM element

name: handleBoxer
description:
Take an event stream and transform it into a stream of handler information
for only specifically requested handler types.

unknown.tagValue: {Observable<jQuery.Event>}
{Observable<Object>} information on relevant boxer handlers

params.name: key
params.description: the handler type we're interested in, e.g., `'clickable'`, or `'*'` for all types

return.description: information on relevant boxer handlers

name: src/artefacts/Box.js
Box
description: Representation of an interactive rectangle in svg space.

name: src/artefacts/BoxBorder.js
BoxBorder
description: Representation of a Box border.

name: src/artefacts/BoxCorner.js
BoxCorner
description: Representation of a Box corner.

name: src/artefacts/Canvas.js
Canvas
description: Representation of an svg canvas used to house boxer artefacts.

name: src/artefacts/Edge.js
Edge
description: Representation of an interactive edge in svg space, spanning between two glyphs.

name: src/artefacts/Glyph.js
Glyph
description: Representation of an interactive glyph in svg space.

name: src/artefacts/LineSegment.js
LineSegment
description: Representation of an interactive line segment in svg space.

name: src/artefacts/SvgArtefact.js
SvgArtefact
description: Abstract representation of an interactive artefact in svg space.

params.name: options.transformation
params.description: the initial transformation of this artefact

name: src/artefacts/SvgTransformable.js
SvgTransformable
description: Abstract representation of an interactive artefact in svg space that can be transformed by affine matrix.

name: src/handlers/Handler.js
src/index.js
src/tools/ClickTool.js
ClickTool
description: A tool for handling clicks on artefacts. Answers to the 'clickable' handler.

name: src/tools/DeleteTool.js
DeleteTool
description: A tool for deleting artefacts on click. Answers to the 'deletable' handler.

name: src/tools/DrawTool.js
DrawTool
description:
A tool for drawing new artefacts inside existing artefacts.
It can draw inside artefacts with the 'drawzone' handler, and
parameters on what to draw can be configured directly.

name: src/tools/GlobalBehaviorTool.js
GlobalBehaviorTool
description:
An abstract class for defining tools that activate or deactivate
exclusive behaviors on screen based on observables.

name: src/tools/HelperTool.js
HelperTool
description:
A debugging tool that can make little red circles appear on-screen
at certain specific coordinates.

name: src/tools/HighlightTool.js
HighlightTool
description:
A tool that can create an animated color-shifting highlighting border
around some artifact based on some observable conditions.
Those specific conditions and the nature of the visual border
are defined inside the tools that want to use highlighting
to signal their state, using `coach.highlightTool.register()`.

name: src/tools/MouseCursorTool.js
MouseCursorTool
description:
A tool that can change the mouse cursor based on some observable conditions.
Those specific conditions and the specific mouse-cursor to use
are defined inside the tools that want to use mouse cursors
to signal their state; using `coach.mouseCursorTool.register()`.

name: src/tools/MouseTool.js
MouseTool
description:
An abstract tool used to create other tools that use mouse input.
It supplies a state machine with meaningful mouse-based states.
(Also happens to signal when ESCAPE is pressed. Not mouse based,
 but it made sense in context.)

name: src/tools/MoveTool.js
MoveTool
description:
A tool for moving artefacts around, and in and out of other artefacts,
using drag-and-drop.

name: src/tools/PanTool.js
PanTool
description: A tool for panning the main canvas using drag-and-drop.

name: src/tools/ResizeTool.js
ResizeTool
description: A tool for resizing boxes by dragging its borders or corners with the mouse.

name: src/tools/RotateTool.js
RotateTool
description: A tool to rotate boxes and their content by drag-and-drop while SHIFT is pressed.

name: src/tools/SelectTool.js
SelectTool
description:
A tool that keeps track of which artefact is 'selected'. That is,
which artefact has the mouse currently pointing at it, but also
taking other factors into account. For example, the selection
can be shifted along the artefact nesting hierarchy by using the
scroll-wheel while ALT is pressed.

name: src/tools/Tool.js
Tool
description: The abstract `Tool` class is the basis of all boxer tools.

name: src/tools/ZoomTool.js
ZoomTool
description:
A tool to zoom in and out on the main canvas using the scrollwheel,
centered around the current mouse-position.

name: src/util/Machine.js
Machine
description:
A finite state machine in which state transitions are controlled by
observables which are only active in specific states.

name: constructor
description: the name of this state machine, used for log output

name: MachineLink
description:
a description of how arrival to a certain state in some other machine leads to a specific state transition in this machine;
the format is `['stateBefore', otherMachine.e('newState'), 'stateAfter']`

name: link
description: the data belonging to the current state

name: extend
description: Extend this machine with additional states, behavior and/or transitions.

params.name: descFn
params.description:
a function that should return an object mapping state-names
                           to functions that may (asynchronously, conditionally) initiate
                           new state transitions in turn. It is passed an object with the
                           `enterState` and `subscribeDuringState`. Use the former to enter
                           new states (can also be bound to an observable). Bind the latter
                           to an `Observable` instead of using `.subscribe` from within a
                           machine state, so it is automatically unsubscribed at a state-
                           transition.

params.name: runCondition

name: unsubscribe
description: Unsubscribe from all currently registered `Observable` subscriptions.

name: enterState
description: Enter a new machine state.

params.name: state
params.description: the new state

params.name: data
params.description: data to send to the new state

name: _runStateSpecificCode
description:
Run the code associated with transition to some specific state.
Running it through this method keeps track of subscriptions returned from it.

params.name: specifiedStateFn
params.description: the code to run

name: src/util/misc.js
src/util/svg.js
M11
description: key to row 1 column 1 in an `SVGMatrix`

name: M21
description: key to row 2 column 1 in an `SVGMatrix`

name: M12
description: key to row 1 column 2 in an `SVGMatrix`

name: M22
description: key to row 2 column 2 in an `SVGMatrix`

name: MX
description: key to row 1 column 3 in an `SVGMatrix`, i.e., x-translation

name: MY
description: key to row 2 column 3 in an `SVGMatrix`, i.e., y-translation

name: refSVG
description: a single <svg> element in memory for utility purposes

name: ID_MATRIX
description: the matrix representing the identity transformation (not changing anything)

name: ORIG_POINT
description: a (0, 0) point in svg space

name: SVGMatrix
description: The `SVGMatrix` class, which is not 'just available' in JavaScript.

name: SVGPoint
description: The `SVGPoint` class, which is not 'just available' in JavaScript.

name: matrixEquals
description: Test equality between two matrices.

return.description: `true` if the two matrices are equal; `false` otherwise

name: setCTM
description: Change the current transformation matrix of an svg element.

unknown.tagValue: {SVGElement} the element to transform
{SVGElement} the element that was transformed (so you could chain other method-calls)

return.description: the element that was transformed (so you could chain other method-calls)

unknown.tagValue: {SVGElement} the svg element of which to get the current transformation matrix

return.description: the current transformation matrix of a given svg element

name: newSVGPoint
description: Create a new `SVGPoint`. The `SVGPoint` class itself cannot be used for this.

return.description: the newly created svg point

name: Vector2D
description:
A representation of a vector in 2D SVG space, not necessarily with a
specific reference-frame.

name: constructor
description: Create a new `Vector2D`.

name: fromMatrixTranslation
description: Create a new vector from the translation component of a matrix.

unknown.tagValue: {Vector2D}  - the new vector

params.name: m
params.description: the matrix from which to take the translation

return.description: the new vector

name: x
description: the x-dimension value of this vector

name: y
description: the y-dimension value of this vector

name: xy
description: a simple `[x, y]` representation of this vector

name: plus
description:
Add this vector to another vector.
Does not modify this vector, but returns a new one.

unknown.tagValue: {Vector2D}       - the pointwise addition of both vectors

params.name: other
params.description: the other vector

return.description: the pointwise addition of both vectors

name: minus
description:
Subtract another vector from this one.
Does not modify this vector, but returns a new one.

unknown.tagValue: {Vector2D}       - the pointwise subtraction of both vectors

params.name: other
params.description: the other vector

return.description: the pointwise subtraction of both vectors

name: times
description:
Multiply this vector by a scalar.
Does not modify this vector, but returns a new one.

unknown.tagValue: {Vector2D}      - this vector multiplied by a scalar

params.name: scalar
params.description: the scalar

return.description: this vector multiplied by a scalar

name: angle
description: Get the angle this vector makes.

unknown.tagValue: {number} the angle this vector makes with the positive y-axis

return.description: the angle this vector makes with the positive y-axis

name: lengthSquared
description:
the length of this vector squared;
use this if you can; it's more efficient than `length`

name: length
description: the length of this vector

name: Point2D
description:
This represents a point in 2D SVG space. It is aware of its x and y coordinates
and of its local coordinate system. When comparing or combining with other
`Point2D` instances, their respective coordinate systems will automatically
be reconciled.

name: constructor
description: Create a new `Vector2D`.

params.name: other.coordinateSystem
params.description: the element defining this point's coordinate system

name: fromMatrixTranslation
description: Create a new Point2D from the translation component of a matrix.

unknown.tagValue: {Point2D} the new point

params.name: m
params.description: the matrix from which to take the translation

params.name: coordinateSystem
params.description: the coordinate system for this new point

return.description: the new point

name: in
description: Get this point, but described in a different coordinate system.

params.name: coordinateSystem
params.description: the coordinate system for this new point

return.description: the same point, but framed by the given coordinate system

name: obj
description:
A convenience function to get a plain `{x, y}` object from this point,
but with configurable keys.

params.name: xKey
params.description: the key for the x coordinate

params.name: yKey
params.description: the key for the y coordinate

return.description: an object like `{ [xKey]: 24, [yKey]: 25 }`

name: plus
description:
Add this point to another point, reconciling their coordinate systems.
Does not modify this point, but returns a new one.
The result of this operation might not make sense unless
you divide the result by 2 (or something).

unknown.tagValue: {Point2D}       - the pointwise addition of both point

params.name: other
params.description: the other point

return.description: the pointwise addition of both point

name: minus
description:
Subtract another point from this one, reconciling their
coordinate systems and returning a vector.
Does not modify this vector, but returns a new one.

unknown.tagValue: {Vector2D}      - the pointwise subtraction of both point

params.name: other
params.description: the other point

return.description: the pointwise subtraction of both point

unknown.tagValue: {number} the Euclidean distance between the two points, squared

params.name: other
params.description: the other point

return.description: the Euclidean distance between the two points, squared

unknown.tagValue: {number} the Euclidean distance between the two points

params.name: other
params.description: the other point

return.description: the Euclidean distance between the two points

name: withFactorTo
description:
Get a point partway between this point and another, the exact
point defined by a factor of the distance between them.

params.name: factor
params.description: the factor determining the location on the `this`-`other` line-segment

params.name: other
params.description: the other point

return.description: `this` * `factor` + `other` * (1 - `factor`)

name: withDistanceTo
description:
Get a point partway between this point and another, the exact
point defined by an absolute distance from this point.

params.name: distance
params.description: the distance from this point from which to take the resulting point

params.name: other
params.description: the other point

return.description: the defined point

name: transformedBy
description: Transform this point by a given matrix.

return.description: this point multiplied by `matrix`

name: scaleFromPoint
description:
Add a scale-from-point transformation onto an existing matrix.
That is, multiply the distance between the given `point` and every
other point by the supplied `factor`.

unknown.tagValue: {SVGMatrix} the matrix to change
{SVGMatrix} the original matrix but with the additional scaling

params.name: factor
params.description: the scaling factor

params.name: point
params.description: the reference point

return.description: the original matrix but with the additional scaling

name: rotateAroundPoint
description: Add a rotate-around-point transformation onto an existing matrix.

unknown.tagValue: {SVGMatrix} the matrix to change
{SVGMatrix} the original matrix but with the additional rotation

params.name: point
params.description: the reference point

params.name: angle
params.description: the angle by which to rotate

return.description: the original matrix but with the additional rotation

name: moveToFront
description: Move a given svg element to the front in terms of 'z-index'.

unknown.tagValue: {SVGElement} the element to bring to front
{Point2D} the original point to snap

params.name: referencePoint
params.description: the point defining the center around which to snap

return.description: the original point snapped to the closest 45-degree line crossing the reference point

name: test/Machine.spec.js
describe0
description: Machine state machine

unknown.tagValue: Machine

name: it1
description: can move from state to state

unknown.tagValue: Machine#extend

name: it2
description: can link states from multiple state machines

unknown.tagValue: Machine#link
